start_here.title: Getting Started with NINA MCP
start_here.description: Essential information to get started with NINA MCP

connection.title: Connection Management
connection.description: Tools for managing connection to NINA server and getting system status

camera.title: Camera Control
camera.description: Tools for controlling the camera and capturing images. Includes the essential nina_capture_image tool which supports different capture modes: download mode for immediate image retrieval and background capture mode for long exposures.

modes.download: Returns image data immediately in JPEG/PNG format, with options for resizing and streaming
modes.background: Captures in background without waiting for completion, ideal for long exposures
modes.platesolve: Can plate solve with or without returning image data

mount.title: Mount Control
mount.description: Tools for controlling the telescope mount, including slewing, parking, and tracking control

dome.title: Dome Control
dome.description: Tools for controlling the observatory dome, including shutter control and mount following

filterwheel.title: Filter Wheel Control
filterwheel.description: Tools for controlling the filter wheel and managing filters

focuser.title: Focuser Control
focuser.description: Tools for controlling the focuser, including movement and temperature compensation

guider.title: Guider Control
guider.description: Tools for controlling the autoguider, including calibration and guiding operations

flatpanel.title: Flat Panel Control
flatpanel.description: Tools for controlling the flat panel, including brightness and cover control

flats.title: Flats Automation
flats.description: Tools for automating flat frame capture, including sky flats and panel flats

image.title: Image Management
image.description: Tools for managing and processing captured images, including history and parameters

rotator.title: Rotator Control
rotator.description: Tools for controlling the camera rotator

utility.title: Utility Tools
utility.description: General utility tools like time functions and wait operations

switch.title: Switch Control
switch.description: Tools for controlling generic ASCOM switch devices such as power boxes, dew controllers, and smart relays

weather.title: Weather Station
weather.description: Tools for connecting to and monitoring weather station devices for comprehensive environmental data

safetymonitor.title: Safety Monitor
safetymonitor.description: Tools for connecting to and monitoring safety devices to ensure safe observatory operations

livestack.title: Livestack Plugin
livestack.description: Tools for controlling the Livestack plugin to get real-time stacked images during imaging sessions

framingassistant.title: Framing Assistant
framingassistant.description: Tools for framing deep-sky objects, calculating moon separation, and determining optimal camera rotation

profile.title: Profile Management
profile.description: Tools for managing NINA profiles, switching between profiles, and modifying profile settings

platesolve.title: Plate Solving
platesolve.description: Standalone plate solving tools for astrometric calibration, mount synchronization, and precise centering. Note: basic plate solving is also integrated into nina_capture_image.

application.title: Application Management
application.description: Tools for managing NINA application state, including version information, startup time, tab navigation, and log retrieval

plugin.title: Plugin Management
plugin.description: Tools for accessing plugin settings and configurations from NINA plugins

event.title: Event Monitoring
event.description: Tools for monitoring NINA events through the websocket event system to track application state changes

sequence.title: Sequence Control
sequence.description: Tools for managing NINA Advanced Sequences, including starting, stopping, loading sequences from files, and retrieving sequence state and structure

nina_capture_image.title: Capture Image with NINA Camera
nina_capture_image.description: Capture an image using the connected camera. Operates in two main modes: download mode for immediate image retrieval and background capture mode for long exposures. Can also perform plate solving with or without image download.

download_mode.description: Returns image data immediately in JPEG/PNG format
requirements: For streaming: stream=True and resize=True required

background_mode.description: Captures in background without waiting for completion
requirements: Image saved by NINA in full resolution

platesolve_mode.description: Plate solving with or without image return
requirements: Can combine with download=True to get both plate solve results and image
Use omit_image=True for plate solve only without image

download.description: Whether to wait for and return image data

resize.description: When downloading, whether to resize the image

quality.description: Image quality: -1 for PNG, 1-100 for JPEG

solve.description: Whether to plate solve the image

omit_image.description: Whether to omit image data in response (useful for plate solve only)

wait_for_result.description: Whether to wait for capture completion. Required for plate solving and image download.
wait_for_result.default: True if solve=True or download=True, False otherwise

returns.SavedPath: Path where image was saved (if applicable)

examples.title: Simple Background Capture
examples.description: Capture a 5-second exposure without waiting for result

examples.title: Download Mode with JPEG
examples.description: Capture and download a resized JPEG image
examples.code: result = await nina_capture_image(CameraCaptureInput(duration=1.0, download=True, resize=True, quality=90, size='1920x1080'))

examples.title: Download Mode with PNG
examples.description: Capture and download a PNG image
examples.code: result = await nina_capture_image(CameraCaptureInput(duration=1.0, download=True, resize=True, quality=-1, size='1920x1080'))

examples.title: Plate Solve Only
examples.description: Capture and plate solve without returning image

examples.title: Plate Solve with Image Download
examples.description: Capture, plate solve, and download the image
examples.code: result = await nina_capture_image(CameraCaptureInput(duration=5.0, solve=True, download=True, resize=True, quality=90, size='1920x1080'))

nina_connect.title: Connect to NINA Server
nina_connect.description: Establish connection to the NINA server. This must be called before using any other tools.

host.description: NINA server hostname or IP address

returns.State: Current server state including connection mode and settings

examples.title: Connect with Default Settings
examples.description: Connect to NINA using default host and port (1888)

examples.title: Connect with Custom Settings
examples.description: Connect to NINA using specific host and port

nina_disconnect.title: Disconnect from NINA Server
nina_disconnect.description: Close the connection to the NINA server and clean up resources.

examples.title: Simple Disconnect
examples.description: Disconnect from the NINA server

nina_get_status.title: Get NINA Status
nina_get_status.description: Get comprehensive status information about all connected equipment and the NINA server.

returns.Message: Status message with connected device count

Status.description: Status information for each equipment type

examples.title: Get System Status
examples.description: Get status of all connected equipment

nina_time_now.title: Get Current Time
nina_time_now.description: Get the current time in various formats including local time, UTC, and Unix timestamp.

Time.LocalTime: Current local time in ISO format
Time.UTCTime: Current UTC time in ISO format
Time.DaylightSavings: Boolean indicating if daylight savings is active

examples.title: Get Current Time
examples.description: Get current time in all formats

nina_wait.title: Wait for Duration
nina_wait.description: Pause execution for a specified number of seconds. Useful for adding delays between operations.

seconds.description: Duration to wait in seconds (can be fractional)

examples.title: Wait 5 Seconds
examples.description: Pause execution for 5 seconds

examples.title: Short Wait
examples.description: Pause execution for half a second

examples.description: Set camera gain to 100 for low sensitivity

examples.description: Set camera gain to 300 for high sensitivity

nina_set_camera_offset.description: Set the camera's offset value for controlling the baseline signal level.

offset.description: Offset value (range depends on camera model)

examples.description: Set camera offset to 50

nina_set_camera_usb_limit.title: Set Camera USB Bandwidth Limit
nina_set_camera_usb_limit.description: Set the camera's USB bandwidth limit to reduce download artifacts and improve stability.

usb_limit.description: USB bandwidth limit value (range depends on camera model)

returns.Success: Boolean indicating USB limit set successfully

examples.title: Set USB Limit
examples.description: Set camera USB bandwidth limit to 40

nina_set_camera_subsample.title: Set Camera Subsampling
nina_set_camera_subsample.description: Set the camera's subsampling for faster readout with reduced resolution.

x.description: X-axis subsample value (1 for no subsampling, 2 for half resolution, etc.)

y.description: Y-axis subsample value (1 for no subsampling, 2 for half resolution, etc.)

examples.description: Set camera to half resolution for faster readout

examples.title: Set Half Brightness
examples.description: Set panel to 50% brightness

nina_turn_flatpanel_on.title: Turn Flat Panel On
nina_turn_flatpanel_on.description: Turn on the flat panel light.

examples.title: Turn On Panel
examples.description: Turn on the flat panel light

nina_turn_flatpanel_off.title: Turn Flat Panel Off
nina_turn_flatpanel_off.description: Turn off the flat panel light.

examples.title: Turn Off Panel
examples.description: Turn off the flat panel light

nina_open_flatpanel_cover.title: Open Flat Panel Cover
nina_open_flatpanel_cover.description: Open the cover of the flat panel if available.

examples.title: Open Cover
examples.description: Open the flat panel cover

nina_close_flatpanel_cover.title: Close Flat Panel Cover
nina_close_flatpanel_cover.description: Close the cover of the flat panel if available.

examples.title: Close Cover
examples.description: Close the flat panel cover

nina_start_sky_flats.title: Start Sky Flats Sequence
nina_start_sky_flats.description: Start an automated sequence to capture sky flats. This will automatically adjust exposure times based on sky brightness.

filters.description: List of filters to capture flats for

count.description: Number of flats to capture per filter

examples.title: Basic Sky Flats
examples.description: Capture sky flats for RGB filters

examples.title: Detailed Sky Flats
examples.description: Capture sky flats with custom parameters
examples.code: result = await nina_start_sky_flats(SkyFlatsInput(filters=['L', 'R', 'G', 'B', 'Ha'], count=20, target_adus=25000, tolerance=500, max_exposure=10.0))

nina_start_panel_flats.title: Start Panel Flats Sequence
nina_start_panel_flats.description: Start an automated sequence to capture flat frames using a flat panel. This will automatically adjust panel brightness and/or exposure times.

filters.description: List of filters to capture flats for

count.description: Number of flats to capture per filter

exposure.description: Fixed exposure time in seconds (if using brightness adjustment)

examples.title: Basic Panel Flats
examples.description: Capture panel flats adjusting brightness only

examples.title: Advanced Panel Flats
examples.description: Capture panel flats with exposure adjustment
examples.code: result = await nina_start_panel_flats(PanelFlatsInput(filters=['L', 'R', 'G', 'B'], count=20, target_adus=25000, adjust_method='exposure', tolerance=500))

nina_stop_flats.title: Stop Flats Sequence
nina_stop_flats.description: Stop the current flats capture sequence.

examples.title: Stop Flats
examples.description: Stop the current flats sequence

nina_get_flats_status.title: Get Flats Status
nina_get_flats_status.description: Get the current status of a flats capture sequence.

Status.IsRunning: Boolean indicating if sequence is running
Status.CompletedCount: Number of flats completed for current filter
Status.TotalCount: Total number of flats to capture for current filter
Status.LastADUs: ADU level of last captured flat
Status.RemainingFilters: List of filters still to be captured

examples.title: Get Status
examples.description: Get current flats sequence status

nina_auto_brightness_flats.title: Auto-Brightness Flats
nina_auto_brightness_flats.description: Start capturing flats with automatic flat panel brightness adjustment for a fixed exposure time. NINA will find the optimal panel brightness to achieve target histogram values.

filterId.description: ID of the filter to use

keepClosed.description: Whether to keep flat panel closed after completion

examples.title: Basic Auto-Brightness Flats
examples.description: Capture 20 flats with 2-second exposure, auto-adjusting panel brightness

examples.title: Advanced Auto-Brightness Flats
examples.description: Capture flats with brightness range limits and specific histogram target
examples.code: result = await nina_auto_brightness_flats(AutoBrightnessFlatsInput(count=15, exposureTime=1.5, minBrightness=10, maxBrightness=90, histogramMean=0.5, binning='2x2'))

nina_auto_exposure_flats.title: Auto-Exposure Flats
nina_auto_exposure_flats.description: Start capturing flats with automatic exposure time adjustment for a fixed flat panel brightness. NINA will find the optimal exposure duration to achieve target histogram values.

filterId.description: ID of the filter to use

keepClosed.description: Whether to keep flat panel closed after completion

examples.title: Basic Auto-Exposure Flats
examples.description: Capture 20 flats with brightness 50, auto-adjusting exposure time

examples.title: Advanced Auto-Exposure Flats
examples.description: Capture flats with exposure time range limits and specific histogram target
examples.code: result = await nina_auto_exposure_flats(AutoExposureFlatsInput(count=15, brightness=60.0, minExposure=0.5, maxExposure=10.0, histogramMean=0.5, binning='2x2'))

nina_trained_dark_flat.title: Trained Dark Flat
nina_trained_dark_flat.description: Start capturing dark flats based on previously trained settings in NINA. Uses the exposure time and other parameters learned from prior flat field training sessions.

count.description: Number of dark flats to capture

filterId.description: ID of the filter to use

keepClosed.description: Whether to keep flat panel closed after completion

examples.title: Basic Trained Dark Flats
examples.description: Capture 20 dark flats using trained parameters

examples.title: Trained Dark Flats with Filter
examples.description: Capture dark flats for specific filter using trained parameters

nina_sequence_start.title: Start Sequence
nina_sequence_start.description: Start the Advanced Sequence in NINA astronomy software. The sequence must be initialized first.

skipValidation.description: Skip validation of the sequence before starting

examples.title: Start Sequence with Validation
examples.description: Start the sequence with normal validation

examples.title: Start Sequence Skipping Validation
examples.description: Start the sequence without validation checks

nina_sequence_stop.title: Stop Sequence
nina_sequence_stop.description: Stop the currently running Advanced Sequence in NINA astronomy software.

examples.title: Stop Sequence
examples.description: Stop the currently running sequence

nina_sequence_load.title: Load Sequence from File
nina_sequence_load.description: Load a sequence from a file in the default sequence folders. Use nina_sequence_list_available to get available sequence names.

sequenceName.description: Name of the sequence to load (from default sequence folders)

examples.title: Load Sequence by Name
examples.description: Load a sequence file named 'Orion'

examples.title: Load Andromeda Sequence
examples.description: Load a sequence for Andromeda galaxy

nina_sequence_json.title: Get Sequence as JSON
nina_sequence_json.description: Get the current sequence structure as JSON. This endpoint is generally advised to use over state since it gives more reliable results. Returns sequence structure with Conditions, Items, Triggers, Status, and Name.

Details.Response: Array of sequence containers with Conditions, Items, Triggers, Status, Name

examples.title: Get Sequence JSON
examples.description: Retrieve current sequence structure as JSON

nina_sequence_state.title: Get Complete Sequence State
nina_sequence_state.description: Get the complete sequence state in elaborate format with plugin support. This is similar to the json endpoint, but more detailed. Use json endpoint for more reliable results unless you need the extra plugin functionality.

Details.Response: Array of sequence containers with full plugin support and detailed structure

examples.title: Get Full Sequence State
examples.description: Retrieve complete sequence state with all details

nina_sequence_list_available.title: List Available Sequences
nina_sequence_list_available.description: List all sequence files available in the default sequence folders. Returns an array of sequence names that can be loaded with nina_sequence_load.

examples.title: List Available Sequences
examples.description: Get all available sequence names

nina_sequence_edit.title: Edit Sequence Property
nina_sequence_edit.description: Edit a property in the current sequence. This is experimental and works with simple types (strings, numbers) but may not work with enums or objects. Use sequence/state as reference for paths, not sequence/json.

path.description: Path to property using format 'Container-Items-Index-Property'. Use GlobalTriggers, Start, Imaging, End for root containers. Example: 'Imaging-Items-0-Items-0-ExposureTime'

examples.title: Edit Exposure Time
examples.description: Set exposure time to 20 seconds in a DSO container

examples.title: Edit Target Name
examples.description: Change target name in the sequence

nina_sequence_reset.title: Reset Sequence
nina_sequence_reset.description: Reset the Advanced Sequence to its initial state.

examples.title: Reset Sequence
examples.description: Reset the sequence to initial state

nina_sequence_set_target.title: Set Sequence Target
nina_sequence_set_target.description: Set the target of a target container in the sequence with coordinates and rotation.

index.description: Index of the target container to update (minimum 0)

examples.title: Set Orion Target
examples.description: Set target to Orion nebula coordinates
examples.code: result = await nina_sequence_set_target(SequenceSetTargetInput(name='Orion', ra=83.82, dec=-5.39, rotation=0.0, index=0))

examples.title: Set Andromeda Target
examples.description: Set target to M31 Andromeda galaxy
examples.code: result = await nina_sequence_set_target(SequenceSetTargetInput(name='M31', ra=10.68, dec=41.27, rotation=180.0, index=0))

nina_sequence_load_json.title: Load Sequence from JSON
nina_sequence_load_json.description: Load a sequence from JSON data supplied in the request. This allows programmatic creation and loading of sequences.

sequenceJSON.description: JSON string representing the complete sequence structure

examples.title: Load Custom Sequence
examples.description: Load a sequence from JSON structure

nina_measure_sky_brightness.title: Measure Sky Brightness
nina_measure_sky_brightness.description: Take a test exposure to measure current sky brightness for sky flats.

Measurement.RecommendedExposure: Recommended exposure time for target ADUs
Measurement.IsTooLight: Boolean indicating if sky is too bright
Measurement.IsTooDark: Boolean indicating if sky is too dark

examples.title: Quick Measurement
examples.description: Measure sky brightness with 1-second exposure

examples.title: Filtered Measurement
examples.description: Measure sky brightness through Luminance filter

nina_get_image.title: Get Image
nina_get_image.description: Retrieve a captured image from NINA. Can return full resolution FITS or resized JPEG/PNG.

path.description: Path to the image file in NINA's image directory

resize.description: Whether to resize the image (only for JPEG/PNG)

examples.title: Get FITS Image
examples.description: Get full resolution FITS image

examples.title: Get Preview JPEG
examples.description: Get resized JPEG preview

path.description: Path to the image file to delete

nina_get_image_statistics.title: Get Image Statistics
nina_get_image_statistics.description: Calculate statistics for a specific image including HFR and star detection.

Statistics.HFR: Half Flux Radius if stars detected

nina_calculate_meridian_flip.title: Calculate Meridian Flip Time
nina_calculate_meridian_flip.description: Calculate when a meridian flip will be needed for a given target.

Calculation.FlipTime: Time when flip will be needed (ISO format)
Calculation.FlipRequired: Boolean indicating if flip will be needed
Calculation.SafetyMargin: Safety margin in degrees before meridian
Calculation.MeridianHourAngle: Hour angle at meridian with safety margin

nina_calculate_target_altitude.title: Calculate Target Altitude
nina_calculate_target_altitude.description: Calculate the altitude of a target at a specific time or over a time range.

time.description: Time to calculate for (ISO format), defaults to now

range_hours.description: Number of hours to calculate for (returns points over time)

SinglePoint.IsVisible: Boolean indicating if target is visible

examples.title: Altitude Over Time
examples.description: Get altitude over next 12 hours

returns.Count: Number of safety monitor devices found after rescan

nina_get_livestack_status.title: Get Livestack Status
nina_get_livestack_status.description: Get the current status of the Livestack plugin. Requires Livestack >= v1.0.1.7. Returns the last reported status even if the plugin is not installed.

nina_start_livestack.title: Start Livestack
nina_start_livestack.description: Start the Livestack plugin to begin real-time stacking. Requires Livestack >= v1.0.0.9. This method simply issues a start command and cannot fail even if the plugin is not installed.

examples.description: Start the livestack plugin

nina_stop_livestack.title: Stop Livestack
nina_stop_livestack.description: Stop the Livestack plugin. Requires Livestack >= v1.0.0.9. This method simply issues a stop command and cannot fail even if the plugin is not installed.

format.description: Optional format (jpeg, png). Default is jpeg

quality.description: Optional quality for JPEG (0-100). Default is 90

nina_get_event_history.title: Get Event History
nina_get_event_history.description: Retrieve event history from the NINA event websocket to track application state changes and operations.

returns.Events: Array of event objects with timestamps and event data
